snippet: President Blaise Compaoré quit as violent protests against his 27-year reign in the West African nation showed no signs of winding down.
abstract: President Blaise Compaore of Burkina Faso announces that he has stepped down, after days of turmoil in which protesters burned Parliament building and set fire to homes of his relatives and aide; his political demise closes book on one of Africa’s most enduring rulers in region where some leaders cling to power for decades; Gen Honore Nabere Traore, chief of staff of Burkina Faso’s armed forces, is taking control.

byline.original: By HERVÉ TAOKO and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Hervé Taoko reported from Ouagadougou, and Alan Cowell from London. Greg Winter and Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Blaise Compaoré quit as violent protests against his 27-year reign in the West African nation showed no signs of winding down.

headline.main: Burkina Faso’s President Resigns, and General Takes Reins
headline.print_headline: Burkina Faso’s President Resigns, and General Takes Reins
